hedline.hl1: A Store Combines Art and Clothing

abstract.p: Russell Steinert and Janis Stemmermann open Spacial Etc, art and clothing store, in Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, NYC; logo (S)

block.p: The atmosphere at Spacial Etc., a store that opened in May at 199 Bedford Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is a mixture of earthy and sophisticated, thanks to the husband-wife owners, Russell Steinert and Janis Stemmermann. He has a European background; she is from a New Hampshire farming family.

''I find European style to be excruciatingly beautiful,'' Mr. Steinert said. ''My wife brings a natural beauty and we've joined the two here,'' he says of the store, an extension of a much smaller shop the two opened across the street in 1996. That one grew out of the wood shop of Mr. Steinert, who is a woodmaker.

The store's products include art from local artists like Klein and Reid, whose surreal sculptures range from $25 to $200. Other local residents are Adrian Jennings, whose lamps depict images like the Brooklyn Bridge and pastoral gardens, with laminated black and white photos making up their shades ($156 to $210), and the clothing and products of Ms. Stemmerman herself, from her company, Brooklyn Handknit.
